definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: I play four instruments, all self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 我会四种乐器，都是无师自通。

sentences.english: I've taught myself how to ride a camel.
sentences.chinese: 我无师自通，学会骑骆驼了。

sentences.english: Even without a teacher, the village people would ask him to run for paper-cut wedding.
sentences.chinese: 无师自通之后，村里人办喜事都会请他出马剪纸。

sentences.english: She learned Latin without a master.
sentences.chinese: 她无师自通学会了拉丁语。

definition: a hint is all that is needed/understanding each other without the need to explain
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
with familiarity you learn the trick (idiom); practice makes perfect
lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)
lit. to stretch a hand and grab it (idiom)/fig. easy to do
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
to have a skill/to have a lot on the ball/to have an affair
